content: Xiaomi Corporation was founded in April 2010 and listed on the Main Board of the Hong Kong Stock Exchange on July 9, 2018 (1810.HK). Xiaomi is a consumer electronics and smart manufacturing company with smartphones and smart hardware connected by an IoT platform at its core. With an equal emphasis on innovation and quality, Xiaomi continuously pursues high-quality user experience and operational efficiency. The company relentlessly builds amazing products with honest prices to let everyone in the world enjoy a better life through innovative technology. Xiaomi is one of the world's leading smartphone companies. As of 2024, Xiaomi ranked among the top 3 in the global smartphone market, in terms of smartphone shipments, according to Canalys. The company has also established the world’s leading consumer AIoT (AI+IoT) platform, with 904.6 million smart devices connected to its platform, excluding smartphones, tablets and laptops, as of December 31, 2024. Xiaomi products are present in more than 100 countries and regions around the world. In August 2024, the company listed as Fortune Global 500 for the 6th consecutive year. Xiaomi is a constituent of the Hang Seng Index, Hang Seng China Enterprises Index, Hang Seng TECH Index and Hang Seng China 50 Index.

Xiaomi Corporation's financial performance for 2024 includes the following key points:

- Xiaomi posted robust financial results in the first quarter of 2025, with revenue surging 47.4 percent year-on-year to 111.3 billion yuan ($15.5 billion) [Note: This is for Q1 2025, not 2024] (2025年5月27日).

- Xiaomi reported record-breaking financial results for 2024, with smartphone revenue reaching CNY 191.8 billion ($26.5 billion), accounting for 52% of overall sales. Xiaomi sold 169 million units in 2024 (2025年3月19日).

- Xiaomi Corporation planned to announce its 2024 Annual Results on 18 March 2025, with an investor conference call/audio webcast scheduled for 18 March 2025 (Tuesday) at 08:30pm (Beijing Time) (2025年3月18日).

- In Q2 2024, Xiaomi's ASP (Average Selling Price) was around 1,102 yuan, slightly down year-over-year but still above the 1,100 yuan median (消息于2025年8月19日发布).

- Xiaomi Corporation planned to announce its 2024 Third Quarter Results on 18 November 2024 (Monday), with an investor conference call/audio webcast scheduled for 18 November 2024 (Monday) at 08:30pm (Beijing Time) (2024年11月18日).

- Xiaomi Corporation announced its 2024 Interim Results on 21 August 2024 (Wednesday), with an investor conference call/audio webcast scheduled for 21 August 2024 (Wednesday) at 07:30pm (Beijing Time) (搜索结果收录于2024年8月21日).

- Xiaomi expands its product portfolio with new smart products such as Smart TVs, Air Purifier, Vacuum Cleaner, Trimmer, and more. (Date: 2023年4月14日)

- From immersive entertainment to fitness, fashion, and smart mobility, Xiaomi has enriched its AIoT portfolio, reinforcing its commitment to innovation. (Date: 2025年3月2日)

- Xiaomi Corporation is an Internet company producing smartphones and AIoT (Artificial Intelligence of Things) devices. (Date: 2021年10月18日)

- Xiaomi rebounds on ecosystem; product portfolio expands through branding of hardware made by partner companies. (Date: 2016年10月24日)

- Xiaomi Youpin (小米有品) includes product categories such as footwear and bags, sports and outdoors, pet supplies, tablets, cameras, washing machines, and personal care items. (Date: 2025年6月30日)

Xiaomi's global market share by smartphone shipments was 14.7% in Q2 2025, ranking it in the top three globally. In smartphones priced at RMB4,000 and above, Xiaomi's market share in units sold was 9.6%, an increase of 2.9 percentage points year-over-year.

Xiaomi has also established a leading consumer-level AIoT (AI+IoT) platform. As of December 31, 2024, the number of IoT devices connected to Xiaomi's AIoT platform (excluding smartphones, tablets, and notebook computers) reached 905 million. In 2023, nearly ** percent of Xiaomi's revenue was generated from IoT and consumer products.

Based on the provided information, here is a comprehensive analysis of Xiaomi Corporation:

### **Company Overview**
- **Founded**: April 2010
- **Listing**: Main Board of the Hong Kong Stock Exchange (1810.HK) on July 9, 2018
- **Core Business**: Consumer electronics and smart manufacturing, with smartphones and AIoT (Artificial Intelligence of Things) devices at its core.
- **Mission**: To deliver high-quality products at honest prices, enhancing global lifestyles through innovative technology.

### **Market Position & Global Reach**
- **Smartphones**: Ranked among the top 3 globally in smartphone shipments as of Q2 2025, with a market share of 14.7%. In the premium segment (RMB 4,000+), Xiaomi’s market share reached 9.6%, up 2.9 percentage points year-over-year.
- **AIoT Platform**: Holds the world’s leading consumer AIoT platform. As of December 31, 2024, over **905 million** smart devices were connected to its platform (excluding smartphones, tablets, and laptops).
- **Global Presence**: Products are available in more than 100 countries and regions.

### **Financial Performance (2024 Highlights)**
- **Revenue**: Achieved record-breaking results in 2024, with smartphone revenue reaching **CNY 191.8 billion ($26.5 billion)**, accounting for **52%** of total sales.
- **Unit Sales**: Sold **169 million smartphones** in 2024.
- **Average Selling Price (ASP)**: Approximately **1,102 yuan** in Q2 2024, maintaining strong pricing power despite slight year-on-year decline.
- **Recent Results**: 
  - Q1 2025 revenue surged **47.4% year-on-year** to **CNY 111.3 billion ($15.5 billion)**.
  - Interim results for 2024 were announced on August 21, 2024, with an investor call held on the same day.

### **Product Portfolio & Innovation**
- **Smart Devices**: Expands continuously with Smart TVs, Air Purifiers, Vacuum Cleaners, Trimmers, and more.
- **Ecosystem Expansion**: Through Xiaomi Youpin (小米有品), the company offers diverse categories including footwear, bags, sports gear, pet supplies, washing machines, personal care items, and cameras.
- **Innovation Focus**: Emphasis on immersive entertainment, fitness, fashion, and smart mobility, reinforcing its commitment to innovation and user experience.

### **Recognition & Index Inclusion**
- **Fortune Global 500**: Listed for the **6th consecutive year** (as of August 2024).
- **Index Constituent**: Part of major indices including:
  - Hang Seng Index
  - Hang Seng China Enterprises Index
  - Hang Seng TECH Index
  - Hang Seng China 50 Index

### **Conclusion**
Xiaomi Corporation has solidified its position as a global leader in both smartphones and AIoT ecosystems. With strong financial performance, expanding product portfolios, and a growing international footprint, Xiaomi continues to innovate and deliver value to consumers worldwide. Its strategic focus on quality, affordability, and ecosystem integration positions it well for sustained growth in the coming years.
